5:30PM-7:00PM

Day 1 – Welcome Reception- Peaks

Join us for a cocktail and hors d'oeuvres reception at the scenic Peaks Restaurant. In addition to drinks and hors d'oeuvres, there will also be vendor exhibitions.

Day 2- Breakfast- Huntley Dining Room

Conference Attendees /

Day 2- Welcoming Remarks- Missouri Ballroom

/   
8:15AM-9:00AM

Day 2- Origins of the South Dakota 24/7 Program- Missouri Ballroom

by Judge Larry Long (Former SD AG and Father of the 24/7 Program)
/   
9:00AM-9:45AM

Attorney General Tim Fox, Colonel Tom Butler
/   
9:45AM-10:00AM

Day 2- Break

Join us for a networking break complete with beverages and light refreshments!
/   
10:00AM-11:00AM

Day 2- 24/7 RAND Study- Missouri Ballroom

Dr. Beau Kilmer presents RAND's findings and details of the evidence-based and peer-reviewed analysis of 24/7.
/   
11:00AM-12:00PM

Day 2- The Psychology Behind the 24/7 Program- Missouri Ballroom

Dr. Keith Humphreys presents the reasoning behind why the 24/7 Program changes behaviors.
/

/   
1:00PM-2:00PM

The National 24/7 Advisory Group discusses best practices to ensure success with the program.
/   
2:00PM-3:00PM

Day 2- 2015 Recidivism Reduction Plan for Alaska & 24/7- Missouri Ballroom

More info to come!
/

7:00AM-8:00AM

Conference Attendees /   
2:30PM-3:00PM

Day 3- Break

Join us for a networking beverage and snack break!
Conference Attendees /   
3:00PM-4:30PM

Day 3- NHTSA Map 21 and the 24/7 Program- Missouri Ballroom

Discussion of the Federal Highway Bill and the 24/7 Sobriety Program, including grant opportunities.
Conference Attendees /   

Event Sponsors / Now Accepting Sponsorships!

Conference Hosted By Montana Department of Justice

Why 24/7? / Why Attend this Conference?

Evidence-based 24/7 Programs are producing data that shows short and long term impact on recidivism for crimes with a nexus to alcohol and drug use. The first statewide program started in South Dakota in 2005, has been studied by Rand Corporation and proven to have a dramatic impact on the recidivism rates of driving under the influence and domestic violence offenses in counties where the programs are active.

by

How can an offender-pay program that have little if any requirement for appropriations, provide such impressive behavioral change? These are some of the questions that speakers at the National 24/7 Summit will address. Additionally, we will have real world users that have implemented the program and are actively running these programs, speaking about the pitfalls and successes that they have encountered. To date there are three states running statewide programs, with pilot programs in four others and administrative rules being written for programs in two additional states.

by

24/7 Programs are: cost efficient -can reduce jail populations -reduce recidivist behavior -are easy to implement. If you are interested in learning more about the 24/7 Program, this meeting is a must.

by

Event Speakers / Keep checking back- more speakers being added soon!

Judge Steven Alm

First Circuit Judge- Criminal Division & Adult Drug Court

Steven S. Alm was sworn in as a First Circuit judge on May 14, 2001 and has been assigned

    Marty Jackley

    South Dakota Attorney General

    On September 4, 2009, Marty J. Jackley was sworn in as the 30th Attorney General for South Dakota. He

    Bill R. Watada

    NHTSA Regional Administrator

    Bill Watada is the Regional Administrator for the Region 8 Office of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA),

    Dr. Keith Humphreys

    Stanford Psychiatry Professor

    Keith Humphreys is a Professor and the Section Director for Mental Health Policy in the Department of Psychiatry and

    Dr. Beau Kilmer

    Co-Director of RAND Drug Policy Research Center

    Beau Kilmer is a senior policy researcher at the RAND Corporation, where he codirects the RAND Drug Policy Research

    Judge Larry Long

    Founder of the 24/7 Sobriety Program

    Larry Long is a lifelong resident of South Dakota. He grew up in Martin, Bennett County, where his

      Colonel Tom Butler

      Chief Administrator- Montana Highway Patrol

      Tom is a Montana Native and received his Bachelor of Science degree in 1991 from Montana State University in

      Tim Fox

      Montana Attorney General

      Tim Fox is originally from Hardin, Montana. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree in geology and a Juris

      See all speakers

      Event Price list / One low rate includes all meals and sessions!

      General Registration

      $125

       Includes conference and all meals. Lodging is not included. Please scroll down for lodging information and options.

      Register

      Event FAQS /

      Contact Us
      • What are my lodging options at Big Sky?
      • Where are the conference facilities located?
      • Will there be a vendor fair at the conference?
      • Will transportation be provided to and from the airport?
      We have reserved the main room block in the Huntley Lodge. These rooms have been secured at the lowest available conference rate. Rooms at the Huntley offer a more typical hotel experience while condo options are also available at a higher negotiated rate. Please note that once our room block is filled, we cannot offer any guarantees that we will be able to secure more rooms. Please reserve yours early!
      The conference will be held in the Missouri Ballroom. The ballroom comprises the Yellowstone Conference Center is attached to the Huntley Lodge and Shoshone Condominium properties.  Please see attached link for map and facility floor plan. YCCfloorplans_v5  
      While, there will be vendors attending the conference, there will not be a vendor fair in the traditional sense. To make the event more interactive and afford maximum networking opportunities, we will have vendor booths and presenters during meal and break times.
      Yes, we've arranged a shuttle service to and from Bozeman Gallatin Field Airport and Big Sky Resort. The shuttle service has been arranged at a discounted rate for the conference. Please see the 'Transportation' heading in the main tool bar above for more details!

      Lodging Info / Reservations now open- make your lodging arrangements today!

      Big Sky Resort is one of Montana’s premier travel and conference destinations. Nestled in the picturesque Madison Mountain Range and conveniently located  between Bozeman, MT and Yellowstone National Park, the resort truly offers something for everyone. A room block has been reserved in the Huntley Lodge. This historic lodge in the center of Big Sky Resort, features dining, shopping, conference rooms and a spa.

      Find Out More about Big Sky! Reserve Lodging

      Event Location

      Big Sky Resort
      50 Big Sky Resort Rd
      Big Sky, MT 59716
      (800) 548-4486

      Get Directions
      Contact Us
      @ 2014 MT DOJ
